extendedIngredients.name: berries
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups of wild berries, you can also use blueberries if you can get them organic even better

extendedIngredients.name: low fat greek yogurt
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2/3 cups low fat organic Greek yogurt

extendedIngredients.name: whole wheat pastry flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cup whole wheat pastry flour, I always use the pastry flour version

recipes.title: Wild Berry Danish Cheese Cake

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are my top picks for Cake. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Heat oven to 350 F. Grease and flour a spring form pan. In a bowl mix eggs, oil, yogurt and sugar. Add the vanilla, flour and baking powder and combine. Pour onto the baking pan. In another bowl whisk cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Add vanilla and egg. Spoon this cheese mixture over the cake batter and spread, leaving one inch margin of cake batter exposed around the perimeter of the cake. Now you can sprinkle the berries over the cheese mixture. Bake for about 55-65 minutes. Cool in pan.TIP: I store cake in the fridge because of the cheese. I just cut what ever piece we are eating and let it sit at room temperature for about 10-20 minutes before eating it.Adapted from Modern comfort food

steps.step: Heat oven to 350 F. Grease and flour a spring form pan. In a bowl mix eggs, oil, yogurt and sugar.
Add the vanilla, flour and baking powder and combine.
Pour onto the baking pan. In another bowl whisk cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy.

Add vanilla and egg. Spoon this cheese mixture over the cake batter and spread, leaving one inch margin of cake batter exposed around the perimeter of the cake. Now you can sprinkle the berries over the cheese mixture.

Bake for about 55-65 minutes. Cool in pan.TIP: I store cake in the fridge because of the cheese. I just cut what ever piece we are eating and let it sit at room temperature for about 10-20 minutes before eating it.Adapted from Modern comfort food
